data.title: Valdosta Daily Times
data.meta_description: Robert White, passed away. This is the full obituary where you can share condolences and memories. Published in the Valdosta Daily Times on 2010-10-29.
data.text:
Mr. Robert White, Sr. was born Nov. 17, 1955 in Lowndes County, Ga. Robert was the fifth of nine children born to the late Mr. Clarence White, Sr. and the late Mrs. Dorothy L. White. He was educated in the Lowndes County School System and became a member of Mt. Zion AME Church at an early age. He enjoyed electric work, fishing and hunting throughout his life.. Robert met and married Aggie Miller and three children were born to this union. He later met and married Barbara Lamb White. One son was born to their union.. Robert was called to his eternal rest on Oct. 22, 2010. He was preceded in death by his parents, three aunts, two uncles and three nephews.. He leaves to cherish his memories his wife, Barbara J. White; four children and two nieces, Robert White, Jr. (Jessica), Darine White, Sr. (Toshiba), Lawrence White, Quentin White, Stephanie White and Ranesha White; four brothers, Charlie James Copeland (Sonya), Clarence White, Jr. (Grace), James White, Sr. (Shirley) and Michael White (Linda); four sisters, Diane White, Kathy White, Barbara G. Roach (Anthony) and Dorothy Primrose (Dwight); eight grandchildren, Darine Jr., Deterrion, Sharmaine, Shartavia, Tyran, Lawrence Jr., Trintia and Austin White; three god children, Clancey White, Allen White and Tyler Roberts; two a special aunts, Mrs. Bernice Lewis and Mrs. Rose Washington of Detroit, Mich.; 10 sisters-in-law, and nine brothers-in-law, special cousins, Victor Norwood, Mary Williams, Phyllis Garth and Mary F. Lofton; special friends, Curtis Robinson, Doug Wright, Ronald Burgman and Nathan Orr; and a host of nieces, nephews, cousins, other relatives and loving friends.. A special thanks to the staffs of Smith Northview Hospital and South Georgia Medical Center.. Funeral service will be held at 3 p.m. today, Oct. 30, 2010 at Mt. Zion AME Church. The Rev. Mark Christmas, pastor and the Rev. Luther B. Robinson, officiating. Burial will follow in Charles Knight Cemetery in Lakeland. - Scott And Roberts Mortuary

Published on October 29, 2010

Plant a tree: How does it work

When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.

An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.

After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.

Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.

Tree Planting Timeline

Orders placed in:

January - May

Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.

June - December

Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
